attributes.action: prosecute those MPs who have abused the allowance system.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
With the recent revelations of MPs who have fraudulently claimed hundreds of thousands of pounds in allowances, the law should firstly be changed, and secondly prosecute those who have abused the system. If an ordinary person were to commit these offences, they would be put on trial, yet these MPs, voted for by the public, and who should be above such things, will probably end up just repaying the money they, in effect, stole, apologising to their constituents, then walking away free men.

This is wrong.

These MPs should be prosecuted.

rejection.details: Government cannot prosecute individuals or organisations. It is the role of the police to investigate suspected crimes, and the role of the Crown Prosecution Service to decide whether there is a case to answer, and to prosecute.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
